ccm_base_frr_ccm_01.name: Ongoing Authorization Reports
ccm_base_frr_ccm_01.description: FedRAMP CCM > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ccm_base_frr_ccm_01.instructions: Providers MUST make an _Ongoing Authorization Report_ available to _all necessary parties_ every 3 months, in a consistent format that is human readable, covering the entire period since the previous summary; this report MUST include high-level summaries of at least the following information:

ccm_base_frr_ccm_02.name: Avoiding Simultaneous Reports
ccm_base_frr_ccm_02.description: FedRAMP CCM > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ccm_base_frr_ccm_02.instructions: Providers SHOULD establish a regular 3 month cycle for _Ongoing Authorization Reports_ that is spread out from the beginning, middle, or end of each quarter.

ccm_base_frr_ccm_03.name: Public Next Report Date
ccm_base_frr_ccm_03.description: FedRAMP CCM > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ccm_base_frr_ccm_03.instructions: Providers MUST publicly include the target date for their next _Ongoing Authorization Report_ with the _authorization data_ required by FRR-ADS-01.

ccm_base_frr_ccm_04.name: Feedback Mechanism
ccm_base_frr_ccm_04.description: FedRAMP CCM > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ccm_base_frr_ccm_04.instructions: Providers MUST establish and share an asynchronous mechanism for _all necessary parties_ to provide feedback or ask questions about each _Ongoing Authorization Report_.

ccm_base_frr_ccm_05.name: Anonymized Feedback Summary
ccm_base_frr_ccm_05.description: FedRAMP CCM > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ccm_base_frr_ccm_05.instructions: Providers MUST maintain an anonymized and desensitized summary of the feedback, questions, and answers about each _Ongoing Authorization Report_ as an addendum to the _Ongoing Authorization Report_.

ccm_base_frr_ccm_06.name: Protect Sensitive Information
ccm_base_frr_ccm_06.description: FedRAMP CCM > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ccm_base_frr_ccm_06.instructions: Providers MUST NOT irresponsibly disclose sensitive information in an _Ongoing Authorization Report_ that would _likely_ have an adverse effect on the _cloud service offering_.

ccm_base_frr_ccm_07.name: Responsible Public Sharing
ccm_base_frr_ccm_07.description: FedRAMP CCM > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ccm_base_frr_ccm_07.instructions: Providers MAY responsibly share some or all of the information an _Ongoing Authorization Report_ publicly or with other parties if the provider determines doing so will NOT _likely_ have an adverse effect on the _cloud service offering_.

ccm_quarterly_reviews_frr_ccm_qr_01.name: Quarterly Review Hosting
ccm_quarterly_reviews_frr_ccm_qr_01.description: FedRAMP CCM > Quarterly Reviews. Impact Levels: Low
ccm_quarterly_reviews_frr_ccm_qr_01.instructions: Providers SHOULD host a synchronous _Quarterly Review_ every 3 months, open to _all necessary parties_, to review aspects of the most recent _Ongoing Authorization Reports_ that the provider determines are of the most relevance to _agencies_; providers who do not host _Quarterly Reviews_ MUST clearly state this and explain this decision in the _authorization data_ available to all _necessary parties_ required by FRR-ADS-06 and FRR-ADS-07

ccm_quarterly_reviews_frr_ccm_qr_02.name: Quarterly Review
ccm_quarterly_reviews_frr_ccm_qr_02.description: FedRAMP CCM > Quarterly Reviews. Impact Levels: Moderate, High
ccm_quarterly_reviews_frr_ccm_qr_02.instructions: Providers MUST host a synchronous _Quarterly Review_ every 3 months, open to _all necessary parties_, to review aspects of the most recent _Ongoing Authorization Reports_ that the provider determines are of the most relevance to _agencies_.

ccm_quarterly_reviews_frr_ccm_qr_03.name: Review Scheduling Window
ccm_quarterly_reviews_frr_ccm_qr_03.description: FedRAMP CCM > Quarterly Reviews. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ccm_quarterly_reviews_frr_ccm_qr_03.instructions: Providers SHOULD regularly schedule _Quarterly Reviews_ to occur at least 3 business days after releasing an _Ongoing Authorization Report_ AND within 10 business days of such release.

ccm_quarterly_reviews_frr_ccm_qr_04.name: No Irresponsible Disclosure
ccm_quarterly_reviews_frr_ccm_qr_04.description: FedRAMP CCM > Quarterly Reviews. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ccm_quarterly_reviews_frr_ccm_qr_04.instructions: Providers MUST NOT irresponsibly disclose sensitive information in a _Quarterly Review_ that would _likely_ have an adverse effect on the _cloud service offering_.

ccm_quarterly_reviews_frr_ccm_qr_05.name: Meeting Registration Info
ccm_quarterly_reviews_frr_ccm_qr_05.description: FedRAMP CCM > Quarterly Reviews. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ccm_quarterly_reviews_frr_ccm_qr_05.instructions: Providers MUST include either a registration link or a downloadable calendar file with meeting information for _Quarterly Reviews_ in the _authorization data_ available to all _necessary parties_ required by FRR-ADS-06 and FRR-ADS-07.

ccm_quarterly_reviews_frr_ccm_qr_06.name: Next Review Date
ccm_quarterly_reviews_frr_ccm_qr_06.description: FedRAMP CCM > Quarterly Reviews. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ccm_quarterly_reviews_frr_ccm_qr_06.instructions: Providers MUST publicly include the target date for their next _Quarterly Review_ with the _authorization data_ required by FRR-ADS-01.

ccm_quarterly_reviews_frr_ccm_qr_07.name: Additional Content
ccm_quarterly_reviews_frr_ccm_qr_07.description: FedRAMP CCM > Quarterly Reviews. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ccm_quarterly_reviews_frr_ccm_qr_07.instructions: Providers SHOULD include additional information in _Quarterly Reviews_ that the provider determines is of interest, use, or otherwise relevant to _agencies_.

ccm_quarterly_reviews_frr_ccm_qr_08.name: Restrict Third Parties
ccm_quarterly_reviews_frr_ccm_qr_08.description: FedRAMP CCM > Quarterly Reviews. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ccm_quarterly_reviews_frr_ccm_qr_08.instructions: Providers SHOULD NOT invite third parties to attend _Quarterly Reviews_ intended for _agencies_ unless they have specific relevance.

ccm_quarterly_reviews_frr_ccm_qr_09.name: Record/Transcribe Reviews
ccm_quarterly_reviews_frr_ccm_qr_09.description: FedRAMP CCM > Quarterly Reviews. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ccm_quarterly_reviews_frr_ccm_qr_09.instructions: Providers SHOULD record or transcribe _Quarterly Reviews_ and make such available to _all necessary parties_ with other _authorization data_ required by FRR-ADS-06 and FRR-ADS07.

ccm_quarterly_reviews_frr_ccm_qr_10.name: Share Recordings Responsibly
ccm_quarterly_reviews_frr_ccm_qr_10.description: FedRAMP CCM > Quarterly Reviews. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ccm_quarterly_reviews_frr_ccm_qr_10.instructions: Providers MAY responsibly share recordings or transcriptions of _Quarterly Reviews_ with the public or other parties ONLY if the provider removes all _agency_ information (comments, questions, names, etc.) AND determines sharing will NOT _likely_ have an adverse effect on the _cloud service offering_.

ccm_quarterly_reviews_frr_ccm_qr_11.name: Share Content Responsibly
ccm_quarterly_reviews_frr_ccm_qr_11.description: FedRAMP CCM > Quarterly Reviews. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ccm_quarterly_reviews_frr_ccm_qr_11.instructions: Providers MAY responsibly share content prepared for a _Quarterly Review_ with the public or other parties if the provider determines doing so will NOT _likely_ have an adverse effect on the _cloud service offering_.

ccm_agencies_frr_ccm_ag_01.name: Review Ongoing Reports
ccm_agencies_frr_ccm_ag_01.description: FedRAMP CCM > Agencies. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ccm_agencies_frr_ccm_ag_01.instructions: Agencies MUST review each _Ongoing Authorization Report_ to understand how changes to the _cloud service offering_ may impact the previously agreed-upon risk tolerance documented in the _agency's_ Authorization to Operate of a federal information system that includes the _cloud service offering_ in its boundary.

ccm_agencies_frr_ccm_ag_02.name: Consider Security Category
ccm_agencies_frr_ccm_ag_02.description: FedRAMP CCM > Agencies. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ccm_agencies_frr_ccm_ag_02.instructions: Agencies SHOULD consider the Security Category noted in their Authorization to Operate of the federal information system that includes the _cloud service offering_ in its boundary and assign appropriate information security resources for reviewing _Ongoing Authorization Reports_, attending _Quarterly Reviews_, and other ongoing _authorization data_.

ccm_agencies_frr_ccm_ag_03.name: Senior Security Reviewer
ccm_agencies_frr_ccm_ag_03.description: FedRAMP CCM > Agencies. Impact Levels: High
ccm_agencies_frr_ccm_ag_03.instructions: Agencies SHOULD designate a senior information security official to review _Ongoing Authorization Reports_ and represent the agency at _Quarterly Reviews_ for _cloud service offerings_ included in agency information systems with a Security Category of High.

ccm_agencies_frr_ccm_ag_04.name: Notify Provider of Concerns
ccm_agencies_frr_ccm_ag_04.description: FedRAMP CCM > Agencies. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ccm_agencies_frr_ccm_ag_04.instructions: Agencies SHOULD formally notify the provider if the information presented in an _Ongoing Authorization Report_, _Quarterly Review_, or other ongoing _authorization data_ causes significant concerns that may lead the _agency_ to remove the _cloud service offering_ from operation.

ccm_agencies_frr_ccm_ag_05.name: Notify FedRAMP of Concerns
ccm_agencies_frr_ccm_ag_05.description: FedRAMP CCM > Agencies. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ccm_agencies_frr_ccm_ag_05.instructions: Agencies MUST notify FedRAMP by sending a notification to info@fedramp.gov if the information presented in an _Ongoing Authorization Report_, _Quarterly Review_, or other ongoing _authorization data_ causes significant concerns that may lead the _agency_ to stop operation of the _cloud service offering_.

ccm_agencies_frr_ccm_ag_06.name: No Additional Requirements
ccm_agencies_frr_ccm_ag_06.description: FedRAMP CCM > Agencies. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ccm_agencies_frr_ccm_ag_06.instructions: Agencies MUST NOT place additional security requirements on cloud service providers beyond those required by FedRAMP UNLESS the head of the agency or an authorized delegate makes a determination that there is a demonstrable need for such; this does not apply to seeking clarification or asking general questions about _authorization data_.

ccm_agencies_frr_ccm_ag_07.name: Notify FedRAMP After Requests
ccm_agencies_frr_ccm_ag_07.description: FedRAMP CCM > Agencies. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
ccm_agencies_frr_ccm_ag_07.instructions: Agencies MUST inform FedRAMP after requesting any additional information or materials from a cloud service provider beyond those required in this policy by sending a notification to info@fedramp.gov.
